DOC.brief_summary: The Common Mental Disorders ( CMD ) refer health state involve non-psychotic psychiatric symptom . Part broad diagnostic category , symptom difficulty concentrating , forgetfulness , insomnia , fatigue , irritability , feeling worthlessness , somatic complaint , etc . The CMD big social impact , prevalence general population 25 % graduate student health care reach 40 % . The Bach´s Flower Remedies consider complementary therapy approve recommended World Health Organization Brazilian Ministry Health theory great spiritual nature . In addition , international scientific research suggest strengthen spiritual well-being help significantly positively promote mental health . This project aim assess relationship treatment Bach´s Flower Remedies Spiritual well-being people Common Mental Disorders undergraduate health student university locate São José do Campos , state São Paulo , Brazil . This research present quantitative qualitative methodology , experimental clinical trial , triple blind . The treatment take place two group forty people , group treatment placebo´s . The trial happen six session interval 30 day , total eight month treatment . Statistical analysis use chi-square Fisher exact test study association scale spiritual well-being use Bach Flowers time point ( 3 time ) . To compare evolution result ( scale ) study set model ordinal data repeat measurement time . For statistical test assume significance level 5 % ( p < 0.005 ) .
DOC.brief_title: Relationship Between Treatment With Bach´s Flower Remedy Spiritual Well-Being People With Common Mental Disorder
